Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: essacramento Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times. Service is always good and friendly staff. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely B&B :-)”
Reviews.Author: Tegz_Rob
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went in Oct 2011 to Amsterdam for a short break away had flights booked but no B&B so when we got to Amsterdam we were recommended this B&B and you cant fault it. The staff were lovely, great breakfast in the morning and there was no noise at night. Its great if you dont mind being outside of the main area of Amsterdam its a tram ride to the centre...on our last day we discovered a lovely cake shop its a must to go to just down the road!! The room that we stayed in had a lovely comfy bed and a separate bathroom...was a walk up and down the stairs but didnt matter to us. We will hopefully be going back to stay in Oct this year for another short break...when i was booking my trip away it was very hard to find a nice B&B for a reasonable price and this ticked all the boxes clean, friendly, own bathroom and good price!! would book here again and close to centre...about 10mins tram ride into centre hope this helps tegan and rob

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhetta
Reviews.Content: The KAP's location is conveniently located close to Van Gough Museum,etc. Our room was not fancy but we were in Amsterdam to see the sites.It was clean and bed was nicely made.Yes,like most older hotels, the stairs are wicked-steep and narrow!! BUT the staff voluntered to handle our luggage. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly;they even offered us a room on the lower floor for the next 3 nights. They also printed out directions to our next hotels in Holland. This senior citizen can only say good things about The Kap.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mbookworm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking for an inexpensive place to stay in Amsterdam, preferring to spend our money out and about than on a fancy hotel. For this, Hotel Kap rated pretty well. It's on a relatively quiet street that isn't a terribly distant walk from the centre, and was indeed inexpensive. I would note that other travellers should definitely be aware of the very steep stairs - we totally underestimated how difficult it would be to carry a heavy suitcase up them! The staff were also friendly and let us check out in the evening as we had to leave before the front desk opened. The room, however, was definitely budget style. The sheets on my bed were ripped and stained, the shower had mold in it, and the hotel only provided a tiny sachet of soap and shampoo. There was just one plug in the entire room, which was already in use, so we had trouble charging our phones and Kindles. This is cheap, but be aware that what you're getting is also cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained, not clean”
Reviews.Author: imdreaming
Reviews.Content: The good: quiet street, close to tram stop The acceptable: narrow, steep stairs. We expected this. Kap seems to be proud of their dangerous stairs. The bad: WiFi never worked (we stayed 4 nights) - a cardinal sin, as the availability of WiFi was one major reason I picked Kap (I have to be able to connect to work, in case of emergency). Our room was never made up by housekeeping before 4:30 PM. Hotel maintenance over the years has been patchwork and marginally-skilled DIY. I'm pretty tolerant, but this was too funky for my style. Bed sheets were an odd set of 2 horizontal sheets. This was uncomfortable in the night as they'd slide around and get tangled. Bed was very soft. Bathroom exhaust fan only worked one night, then died. In a very humid climate, this caused nasty steamy room. Bathroom sink is cracked. Toilet had no cover on it. Drains stank. Mildew stains in the shower and on bathroom wall. The table in the garden had the same drink rings on it during our entire stay. The PC in the dining room was infected with viruses (only used to check in for flight).

Reviews.Title: “HAVE BEEN HERE 5 TIME FOR A TOTAL OF 48 DAYS AND LOVE IT”
Reviews.Author: mfreshour
Reviews.Content: The hotel Kap is on a one way street, quiet and not very busy. Tram and bus stops within 1 block and the Carousel restaurant in the park down from the hotel. Rooms were clean and fresh , the staff were also very friendly and helpful except for one and he knows who he is I am sure his aloof (Synonym) attitude has hurt their business some. I would recommend this hotel to anyone of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: INDIAS
Reviews.Content: Well located. You can go walking almost everywhere. Very good breakfast. Excellent internet (paid but reasonable price and always working) and comfortable rooms. The day we left, we needed to have breakfast very early in the morning, so they prepared a breakfast-box to take the previous night to our room and have breakfast early the following morning. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a week in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_2011ich
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 7 nights at the Kap Hotel in July. It was a great base for visiting Amsterdam. The breakfasts consisting of fresh rolls, home made muffins, cold cuts, cheeses, cereal were ample and kept us well fueled for sight seeing. Our family room with bathroom was very comfortable. The very steep stairs ( not unusual for Amsterdam) were quite daunting at first but by the end of the week they didn't bother us at all. Carrying large suitcases up those stairs would definitely be a challenge. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Museumplein ( Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum) and Albert Culptstraat Market. It's about a 30 minute walk from Centraal Station ( thankfully away from the crowds and congestion) or a 15 minute tram ride. We had tram passes as part of our IAmsterdam Card package but only used them twice. The city is extremely walkable. We were happy to find a laundromat just a block away from the hotel. The "Carousel" restaurant just around the corner makes awesome Pannekoeken and is also great place to stop for a beer in the afternoon. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. They even heated Lasagne for the kids ( who were too tired to go to dinner with us). We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Kap and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Roaming12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Kap in March 2011. Room: I stayed in a single room which was quite sparten and basic, but clean. It included a single bed, a wash basin and a shower but without a separate toilet. A communal toilet was located along the corridor not far from my room. Admittedly it was a bit depressing returning to my match box sized room! The room did include a very small TV. My room was on the top floor which meant climbing a very steep staircase - but this is typical for Amsterdam traditional houses. Service: The people running the hotel were very friendly and welcoming and happy to answer questions about where to go and what to see as a tourist. They were also helpful pointing out where the nearest tram stop is and how to get to and from the centre. Breakfast: My room rate included breakfast which included a small selection of cereals and breads and coffee and tea. The small breakfast room is located on the ground floor towards the back of the hotel. I found this to be adequate and suited my needs but I wouldn't rave about the breakfast. Location: Located just off one of the outer canals in a quiet street. To get to most tourist sites you would need to take a tram (which run frequently) or taxi. If you want to be within short walking distance of central Amsterdam, you may prefer to stay antoher hotel located a little closer to the very centre. Value: I found the hotel to be very good value. Although acommodation is very basic I found the hotel rates to be very reasonable for Amsterdam. Therefore, I was willing to accept going without any "luxuries" in order to get this good hotel rate. I think this ideal if you are looking purely for a base to drop your things, are willing to accept basic accommodation, expect to spend limited time in your hotel room (sleeping only) and will spend most your time out exploring Amsteram.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TomasTT
Reviews.Content: all premises were worn out, like time has stopped there long time ago. breakfast was average (somewhere I read they offer nice rich dutch breakfast, but then half of the world is offers that "nice dutch breakfast) Room was clean but oldish. I stayed on top floor and climbing up was quite experience. I have not seen so steep steps, but it's normal in Amsterdam (narrow and high houses), not only in this hotel Location was good, 10 min walk to center (Rembrandt plein /square/ or to Leidse plein square/ where were lot of restaurants. Tram stop was 500 m from hotel Overall nothing bad

Reviews.Title: “I TRULY LOVED KAP!”
Reviews.Author: Perla_Bologna
Reviews.Content: I was in Kap for a week,in the smallest room,I suppose,but it was so nice! The room was clean and in a good position,the street is very silent and bright,with big trees...but the best of the Hotel Kap is the staff,that is very very kind and sweet! I loved the breakfast too,and the atmosphere in general,it was very friendly and lovely....the hotel has also a little space outside with tables,for relax,watching the trees and listening to the birds singing... The position of the Hotel is perfect,is 10 minutes walking to the center,and is also next to the museum area,5 minutes walking from the Hotel.I always moved by feet and bicicle,everything was very close to the Kap! I TRULY LOVED KAP!

Reviews.Title: “Goo dLocation”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLovesEurope
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in May in a quadruple room. The room itself was quite large, but the bedding situation could've been better. There were two single beds and a double pull out couch that was very very old. The mattress was very thin and the frame could be felt while laying on it. We had to use extra blankets for padding. The frame also was sunk down at the head, so when lying down your feet were raised up. The pull out was not stated in the room description, nor was there a picture showing the actual beds. On the second day the toilet leaked from the base and the water was really bad smelling. We cleaned it up as best we could but we found housekeeping just picked up the towels, so there was still an unpleasant smell to the bathroom. We also had trouble connecting to their wireless, but they refunded the 5 euro charge and gave us use of the computer in the reception. Breakfast was continental but offered a wide variety of meats, cheeses, buns, cereals and other pastries. The eating room and patio were very nice. The staff was very friendly and eager to answer questions and give directions or recommendations. The location is the shining star of the hotel. Very close to the Heineken experience and tram lines that take you right downtown. It was very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: sae1220
Reviews.Content: Located in a great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and bright and the breakfast buffet was good. Only two minor things, first the stairs are very steep and narrow. This is typical of Amsterdam, but was hard for carrying large suitcases up the stairs with no elevator. Second, the ceiling in the shower was dripping water a little bit, which was a little gross. Overall, the perfect hotel for students traveling on a budget looking to stay in a nice part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: obninsk23
Reviews.Content: Well, the room was 65 euros for two beds with clean sheets and very nice breakfast. You can not find anything cheaper for what you get in down town Amsterdam. 5 min walk to Heineken Brewery. 10 min to museums. Of course the room is small, bathroom is tiny, the sink is cracked, but this does not bother me. If it bothers you go to a better hotel and expect to pay $110 euros.

Reviews.Title: “good, but old-fashioned”
Reviews.Author: mittelwerk108
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel on a quiet residential street, just north of De Pijp, and within easy walking distance of the museum district. Single room was cosy and clean, but the decor is very outdated. The shower had good pressure, but the the drain was slow. Plenty of english-language TV channels. Friendly service. Breakfast is quite meagre, but adequate. I'll stay here again for the quiet location and cosiness.

Reviews.Title: “exellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: moshe613
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a budget-hotel located in central Amsterdam, which is well known as an expensive city; after searching so much in the web, I came across the Kap hotel, via the Trip Advisor website. Before I ordered a room, while I was at home, I contacted the hotel and they replied my emails quickly and efficiency. The Kap hotel is located in a quiet and lovely neighborhood, about 1 minute walks from the Heineken brewery museum and most of Amsterdamâ€™s museums, and about 20 minutes walk (or 10 minutes with the Tram) from the Dam Square (close to the hotel you will find most of the Tram lines, which takes you everywhere in Amsterdam). However, I must emphasize that the staff is very friendly and always ready to assist. Even when I left Amsterdam for couple of days, I was allowed to leave my personal belongings there. The staff also offered me discounts tickets to museums and other attractions. The hotel has wireless access, which cost you 5 euro, or use the computer and printer located at the reception hall. The room was cleaned-up every morning, and hot water were all day and night, the beds were cleaned and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel, as budget-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and cozy stay”
Reviews.Author: cmcs13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kap is in a great location. Still quite central, but now where it's busy and loud. You can either walk or take the tram to central Amsterdam. Rijksmuseum and Museumplein is just a couple of blocks away. The hotel is pretty cozy, beware of very steep stairs to the rooms, but that's normal and to be expected in Amsterdam. The breakfast was awesome and the staff helpfull. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very cosy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenaMF
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very cosy. the rooms where warm and spacious, breackfast really good!the staff was also very helpfull. only 2 things: the watyer in the bathroom didnt have a good flow and the staircase is quite steep. we didnt mind, but i guess an older person would habe a problem. would stay there again though!

Reviews.Title: “What would you expect in a 2 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Ulrick
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kap is a 2 star hotel which is situated in a quiet location near Heineken brewery and a walking distance to major museums. However, please be advice that their given instructions on how to get to the hotel by tram from Amsterdam Central Station posted in their website and from the letter I received from them was very misleading. As i quote from their letter â€œCross the bridge back across the waterâ€�. Seriously, you donâ€™t need to cross any bridge at all. The good news is, they edited their instructions already but as a precaution to future visitors, it pays to study the location of the hotel in a map because its really easy to find, they just mess up with their instructions. The room that i reserved was a double with shower and toilet, was pretty spacious but disappointingly the interior was outdated. The bed that was pushed together to make it double was old yet clean smelling. The TV was pathetically small, it was 12 inches so itâ€™s quite hard to watch a program while sitting on the bed. The noise on my next door neighbour was audible and quite annoying especially when I got to rest early. As for the toilet, it was hideous. The sink has cracks on it, there is no holder for the shower, the air exhaust was very dirty which make it very noisy and lastly the toilet bowl was pretty outdated and very funny because the water out of the bowl is in front. Every time I use the bowl I have to constantly flush so as to get rid of any unwanted smell. It was really terrible to use that kind of toilet bowl. (please see pictures) With regards to their breakfast buffet, it was decent continental breakfast which includes bread, cereal, yoghurt, cheese, meat, hard boiled eggs, crackers, marmalades and muffins. As for the drinks, they served coffee, packed powdered chocolate drink, one kind of juice and tea. As for the internet, I have to pay extra 5 Euros valid for my entire stay. The connection was fast every time I use my laptop or iphone in their Lounge area but terribly slow or mostly no signal at all when I tried to access in my room at the 4th floor. Overall, my experience in Hotel Kap was acceptable in a way that things work out just well. It was just pretty sad that the establishment has the upper hand in terms of location but the management failed terribly to upgrade their basic amenities and left the room in their decaying worn-out state. Nevertheless, I would still recommend this hotel especially for people who want value for their money considering that most hotels in Amsterdam are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: redlybarian
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and were glad to find a friendly face upon our late arrival (on account of train delays). The staff who worked the desk were excellent at giving directions and advice, though they weren't intrusive. Breakfast was one of the nicest I have seen in a long time- deli meats, cheese, rolls and bread/crackers, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, milk, hot chocolate, etc. Our room had a shower ensuite, but it was really awkward as I was staying with a male friend. There was no partition between the room and the shower at all, and the room looked directly upon the shower. The toilet was pretty convenient to the room. If you savor quiet, this is the place for you. Not only were we sheltered from the noise of the others staying here, but Kap is on a quiet street in an old, interesting building. That said, it is less than a block to a main street and the Heineken Experience. The only other disadvantage is the wired internet access (we didn't have a laptop), which is in the reception area. My friend reported that it was dreadfully slow and he spent all his time just trying to connect.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: budgetqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights here. Booked a twin shared toilet room with a shower in room. Was serviced nicely every day and although tiny, ok for the prices of Amsterdam. The location was excellent and offered easy access to city touring. I do agree that the staff, for the most part, is stand offish and not real friendly. But not rude and did do their job. Breakfast was fine, and tables never hard to get. The location was superb for using cheap public transportion- tram.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TravelsAroundWorld
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 with a young child, stayed 3 nights at this well located and comfortable hotel. We found the hotel itself to be a bit worn but clean and comfortable. Our son found the narrow, steep stairs a challenge he enjoyed. The hotel is on a quiet street within walking distance of the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Leidesplein. We even walked to the main train station and back. We had a great vegetarian dinner at the Golden Temple an easy walk from the hotel. The tram is very close to the Hotel as well. The breakfast was great (hard boiled eggs, cheese, meats, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee and milk). We all enjoyed the yummy chocolate chip muffins as well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We were not traveling with a laptop or netbook, so it was nice to connect to the internet, check email and buy our tickets online for the Rijksmuseum and avoid lines. Hotel Kap was a great place to rest after a long day sightseeing in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming time capsule”
Reviews.Author: EverettEightball
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kap was a charming hotel experience. The room we stayed in was like an apartment, with a detached toilet and shower area. This was an odd experience, but our kids had a lot of fun with the wackiness of the room. Our second bed was a Murphy bed, which was a fun novelty as well. Hotel staff was very nice - they went out of their way to be pleasant at breakfast. And breakfast was quite nice. Location was also great. We just walked everywhere in Amsterdam, and there was no stress to that with the location of the Kap.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: uctmd77
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quaint, very clean and well located close to Van Gogh and Rijks museums, and to a tram stop, at a very reasonable rate. Easy walking distance to Anne Frank, Dam Square and RL district. We had a quad room (2 beds pulled down) with bathroom and it was adequate, although quite small with all 4 beds in use. Since we spent only sleeping hours in the room, it was fine. No elevators so you do have to carry bags up a fairly narrow (though far from the worst we encountered) stairway. A generous continental breakfast which includes boiled eggs, ham, cheese etc,is served in a lovely back yard with tables and chairs. Since we were leaving early on our last day, the staff left boxed breakfasts (sandwiches, fruit, juices) and a flask of coffee in our room the night before Reception staff is wonderful - extremely helpful and friendly. Helped us get our museum tickets online and printed them out free of charge. They have made up all sorts of booklets, walking tours etc and clearly are committed to making your stay comfortable and memorable. They do rent bikes though we didn't use them so I can't speak to the quality of the bikes. Wi-fi internet is available for 5 euros for your entire stay. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault Kap!”
Reviews.Author: crazynready
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kap end of April and loved it...altho there were two of us we stayed in room 4 which could sleep 5 we only did this because my friend was funny bout sharing a bathroom so we got ensuit. Bathroom was clean and tidy. Couldnt fault the staff at all....polite and helpful...asked before hand about smoking policy and they say they do have one but have no was enforce it...so we hot boxed room morning and night no1 mentioned anything at all! Would stay here again....bout 15 min walk from everywhere if u know the way...take a map! Kap gets 10 out of 10! Unfortuantly didnt wake up in time for breakfast but it smelt lovely! Staircase is pain in the butt (literally) but everywhere in Dam has these staircases! Quiet road but central..perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Comfortable, & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: mich40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Kap for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the charm of this place! Rooms are spacious and warm and the breakfast is wonderful! This hotel is walking distance from the Rjeiksmuseum and all districts of Amsterdam. The staff were friendly and accomodating in answering our questions. When we had to leave in the early morning to catch our flight, missing breakfast, the staff made us breakfast the night before along with coffee in a thermos that kept warm overnight so we could eat in our room at 4:00 a.m. before leaving to catch our train.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, decent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Lousy1903
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night in the luxury room with bath - bathroom was not within the room but next door. Huge room with beds and sofa bed but 2 single beds instead of a double as requested. Dated decor but fitted with the building and makes a change to using chain hotels. Steep stairs, much easier going up than down! Quiet expensive for a 2* but was booked through VVV last minute so may be able to get cheaper rates. Located off the main street so very quiet through the night but close enough to walk to busy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Kap”
Reviews.Author: LeffeBoy
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Kap. Yes the stairs are a bit of a white knuckle ride and the room decor a little dated, but it does have a traditional Amsterdam house feel to it, that larger chain hotels don't. Our room was clean and well serviced. Our party of 7 booked on-line and found it good value compared to other hotels in the city. The owners were friendly and humorous, and the breakfasts simple but satisfying. The location was good for us - being slightly out of the centre allowed us some peace at night and the opportunity to experience parts of City we had not seen on previous visits.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the Kap”
Reviews.Author: kmsquared
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed another pleasant stay at the Hotel Kap, which has become like our "home from home" when we are in Amsterdam. It's always nice to greet the front desk personnel, who have come to feel like friends. Thanks for the enjoyable stay, Harry, Bruno, and Hans! The simple but nutritious and ample breakfast buffet is always a great way to start the day. Typically, there's coffee, tea, milk, cold cereal, toast with jam and butter, rusks, cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers, hard-boiled eggs.... The location is great: The Kap is within walking distance of the Museumplein (Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum) and the Concertgebouw, as well as Vondelpark. Also, nearby Weteringcircuit is a hub for public transport that reaches to every corner of the city. Yet because the Kap is on a tiny side-street, it is usually very quiet. Hans says that he'll be giving the Kap a complete facelift during 2008. As always, I only wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: MarvLiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located for easy access to this culturally rich city. Be sure to bring the email confirmation with you. The concierge who looked indifferent and rude was charging us 18 euros per day more than the confirmed rate. As soon as I showed the email confirmation, he didn't say a word. I asked for a receipt but told me that the email was more than enough. You have to get out of your bedroom to go to the bathroom...not a good idea! J and J of New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ynot
Reviews.Content: Very nice, small hotel located near most of the musuems, parks, and areas of interest. The room was ample sized, abeit a bit spartan in decor. Depending on the person at the front desk, the staff was either indifferent or friendly, but still pleasant. The breakfast was nicer than what we had expected. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AliceDee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at Hotel Kap. We had a double room (with shower and toilet) that looked over the courtyard in back. While not fancy, our room was very clean and we did not detect any type of strange odors mentioned in some older reviews. The beds were very comfortable and our room was scrupulously cleaned each day with fresh towels provided. The breakfast was good, and while it wasn't warm enough to dine outside, I did wander out there to pet the neighbor's cat, Freek, who was watching us eat through the window, and it is a pretty courtyard. The neighborhood is very quiet and residential, with kids out playing in the street. We did lots of walking and felt totally safe, even late at night. Beautiful Reguliersgracht is right around the corner, and there are lots of good restaurants nearby on Utrechtsestraat. We also discovered a couple of pubs we really liked in de Pijp, a few minutes walk south of the hotel near the Heineken Brewery (Cafe Berkhout and Gollem II). The staff was professional and competent, and while not overly friendly, they were polite and we weren't expecting the hotel staff to be our new best friends anyway. They did a great job of being hotel staff, though :-)! I felt like our rate was totally fair, and I'd stay there again without hesitation! Go Hotel Kap!! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Born_yesterday
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Amsterdam, and I'm now thoroughly convinced that all hotel rooms in this city are tiny and very overpriced. First the good part: Hotel Kap is in a nice residential street that is quiet and near the tram stop. The facade of the hotel is classic Amsterdam architechture and it is good to look at. Breakfast is decent, with an assortment of cold-cuts, cheese, eggs, bread, and cereals. Breakfast is included with the room and its served 8:30 AM - 10:30 AM. Now for the criticisms: we booked a double room and it was very small, and we paid a respectable price for it: over US$100 per night. My wife and I could hardly fit in there! There were two single beds whereas we would have preferred a single big bed, but it seems this is typical in many Dutch hotels. The staff at the front desk was not terribly friendly when we asked them some simple questions about museums and so on. I would stay at this hotel again but only if they were to lower the price to reflect the actual value.

Reviews.Title: “Urine”
Reviews.Author: room15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Kap over the weekend. I booked for 2 nights. I dropped my bag off in the room at midday to take in the sites of the city which are not too far away. On returning that evening the room smelt of urine. The room does not have a toilet. The shower in the corner has obviously been well used over the years. The stench was unbearable!! There is noone at reception after hours. The reception is locked. The bed is a little fold away and this was crawling with fleas!! To make my night even worse, if that was possible, a healthy rat ran right along the open window sill, which is at head level. This night was the worse night possible, I have never felt so dirty in all my life. I stood downstairs ibn the road for an hour and ventured up again. I decided not to stay the other nighht, but rather to sleep at the airport, and forego another day in Amsterdam. Hotel Kap, or room 15, that I saw should be condemned! It is not a hotel, but a doss house.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good but kind of pricy”
Reviews.Author: Xienon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in early May in a triple room and paid 124 EUR per night. The room had 3 single beds with the third bed being a Murphy bed (folds into the wall). The size of the room was quite generous but the bathroom was tiny and had a slightly unpleasant smell. The furnishings in the room did not feel old at all and was very clean. The breakfast provided by the hotel was pretty good. In addition to cereal, bread, and egg, there were meat and cheese. The entire breakfast area was also very clean. Like other reviewers mentioned, the stairs here are very steep so if you have difficulties with mobility, those stairs will be difficult to climb. The hotel is located in a very quiet residential area. The tram is only a 3 minute walk away. It's about a 10 minute walk to Rijksmuseum and about 30 minutes to the city center. The tram can get you to the city center in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price but very old”
Reviews.Author: OVV
Reviews.Content: Old hotel.Room vas big but furniture is old.If you want to call or somebody call to you,you have to go downstairs.Everything looked like 20 years old,durty carpet.Brakfast was ok. The second night they even didn't bother to make the beds It is ok,for the price they charge in Amsterdam,but I'll not recommend it for a long stay. Not far from center.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bethyng
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kap is your basic, budget hotel. Yes, there are a lot of narrow, windy stairs. If you can't handle it, go to a chain hotel. It was clean and inexpensive. The manager was nice. Breakfast is nothing wonderful but it's something to get into your stomach before you start your day. The only reason I wouldn't stay there again is that I would prefer something more central like Dam square. Of course that costs more money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: CathyStl
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay here. As a single woman traveling alone, I wanted a safe, yet cheap, place to stay. Hotel Kap was clean, quiet, has a super-cute garden area (okay the stairs are a little steep;), great breakfast and all for a pretty decent price. The location is within walking distance to all the museums also. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat for kindness and quaintness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Kap in September 2005. Arrived with horrrrible case of jet lag...to early to check in. But check in I was allowed to do. My room wasn't ready so the wonderful gentleman at the desk upgraded me from a two-person room to a four-person at no aditional charge. I must have looked as bad as I felt! He ended up losing money on this b/c the hotel was full most of the week my daughter and I were there. Great breakfast. Can't-be-beat location. We walked to most everything but the hotel is easily accessible to tram system; on Connexxion Shuttle route. Steep steps got steeper as the week went on (no lift) but I always look for Old World, not shiny Western fare. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, this is not a habitable establishment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start... Hotel is located in a nice location and that is the only nice thing in my review. Hotel staff is borderline rude, impolite and have no concept of service. No lift and the stairs are unbelievebly narrow and the steps are not even 9" wide and imagine carrying bags and suitcases 3 floors. One day we forgot few essentials in the room and we decided not to go back to room to fetch them. Room was small, no surprise by most european hotel standards, but the rooms were prehistoric, especially the carpet and the toilet. Speaking of small, when you sat on the toilet your face was in the sink, really, not exaggerating. Adding to this it was stinking, when we reported this to the front desk, his solution was to put some drain cleaner and that was the end of it. Breakfast - if you can call that, we skipped after first day because it was completely inedible. Please do yourself a favor and look for a decent bench in a park or a train station instead.

Reviews.Title: “Big room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall it was OK. The room was really big, the only problem was the bathroom. It smelled. I think it's just old and wasn't renovated for some time, so you can't clean it up to 100% any more. Breakfast wasn't very interesting. The nice thing about the hotel (but maybe it's happening in all Amsterdam hotels) the radiators were a bit warm, especially during the night. Very helpful, even though it was June. It's on a nice, quiet street, very close to the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very clean, quiet and comfortable. The breakfast and the small garden near the breakfast area was a very relaxing way to start the day. The hotel is within walking distance from all the major attractions, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “so good am goin back tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A really good value hotel with a decent breakfast enjoyed my stay there hugely, infact enjoyed it so much that am returnin to it very soon. The patio was really good for realaxing during the evening and the staff were helpfull and the room was always cleaned. Just one thing the mattresses slip off the beds a little but this is a very minor complaint for such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value - Great location - Will Definitely Book Again!!”
Reviews.Author: AJW1966
Reviews.Content: Excellent value hotel in a very quiet leafy suburban street. Within easy reach of all the major attractions, either by foot or public transport. Nearest tram stop is 2 minutes walk. Room and bathroom were very clean. Superb breakfast with choice of cereals, toast, preserves, ham, cheese, eggs, tea/coffee, juice, fruit.....wow!! We had a room on the street side and the only noise you could hear was the occasional tram bell. Den Tex Straat is a one way street containing a mixture of small hotels and residences. Hardly any passing traffic at all. The staircase is a little steep and there's no elevator....but I think that's part of the fun with Amsterdam townhouses. Staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller hotel located a very short walk from the major museums and near the brewery and near the Asterisk Hotel. It is located on a very quiet pleasant residential street. Pros: The hotel and the room was, in general, very clean and nice. The en suite facilites were nice and worked well. By Amsterdam standards, the facility was fairly smoke free. Breakfast area was very nice and the food decent. You are provided with a key to both the front door and your room. The staff were *very* helpful and efficient (and helped address a medical issue that poped up). The rooms were very quiet (yes, the occasional guest let his/her door slam) with zero street noise. By Amsterdam standards, the stairs were fairly easy. Lots of TV channels is lots of languages... The location was great -- right on several major tram lines (16, 24 and 25) -- make it easy to get to centraal station and old town. It is also a reasonable walk to the center of town (30 minutes?) or Rembranstplein (10 minutes?). The Rijks is no more than a five to seven minute walk. Small shops and restaurants also close by. Overall, a great value. Cons: The carpeting is less than ideal. It was cheap carpet to begin with and has become stained over time. Room lighting could be better at night (although that huge window is great during the day!).

Reviews.Title: “loved the kaphotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the previous reviewer put her comments with the wrong hotel.We stayed at the Kap 3 weeks ago and had a great time. The room was big and cozy with red carpeting and modern chandeliers, the beds were comfortable box spring beds.The bathroom was large and comfortable and everything very clean. The breakfast was a great surprise with various breads and a large selection of preserves.Ham, cheese and another kind of meat,Eggs still warm in the basket,canned and fresh fruit.Cereal.Cucumber,tomatoes and pickels.And plenty of coffee,tea,OJ and milk.We even had the breakfast, due to the good weather in the beautifull patio/garden in the back.Overall much better and cheaper than the hotel in London we stayed in before this hotel.And the staff was very friendly and helpfull.By the sound of it the milk was not the only thing that was 'off'We can surely recommend this hotelBryan and Sue

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay at Hotel Kap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was horrible, just cereal, toast and tea with stale milk. The shower leaked through the ceiling which we were made to feel guilty about... it wasn't our fault! The double bed was made up of two single mattresses on a double base which were very soft and kept slipping off the base during the night. The hotel was also very noisy at night and in the morning with furniture being moved around above our room. People were also slamming dorrs throughout the night. Therefore my partner didn't get much sleep. We won't be recommending this hotel to anyone! It was awful!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four days and had a great time. The room was big and cosy. The street is very quiet but right in the middle of everything. The bathroom was very clean and the brakfast was fantastic! We highly recommend this hotel, it has everything you need and it's really not expensive.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Kap
HotelInfo.Address: den Texstraat 5b, Amsterdam 1017XW, The Netherlands
